name: Catholic Asia in the Early Modern Era, 1500-1800
description: This course examines the impact of Catholicism in Asia, from its introduction to its relevance in the contemporary global order. Students will be introduced to how Catholicism and the technologies accompanying it affected historical transitions in local communities in Asia as well as how the growth of these communities has affected the global Catholic Church.
prerequisites: 1.0 FCE in European or Asian history, or permission of course instructor
